articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Portrait of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Portrait of Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of laying a floral basket before a portrait of President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK was held by the Afro-Asian and Latin American People's Solidarity Organisation on September 8.
 Members of the organisation laid the floral basket before the portrait of Kim Il Sung before making a bow.

articles.title: Rwandan President Hopes for Expanded Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
Rwandan President Hopes for Expanded Cooperation with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Rwandan President Paul Kagame hoped that cooperation between the two countries would be expanded still further in different fields, when meeting the DPRK ambassador to Rwanda who was present at the presidential inauguration as a special envoy of the DPRK government on September 12.
 The president expressed thanks to the DPRK government for sending a special envoy to his inauguration and said that the government of Rwanda wishes the Korean people greater success under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

DPRK-China Cooperation in Quality Certification
articles.content:
DPRK-China Cooperation in Quality Certification 
    Beijing, September 16 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in quality certification was signed between the State Bureau of Quality Control of the DPRK and the State Certification and Accreditation Administration of China in Beijing on Sept. 15.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of a delegation of the State Bureau of Quality Control of the DPRK led by its Vice-Director Son Pyong Hak and Liang Jie, vice-president of the State Certification and Accreditation Administration of China, and its members.    
 And a 2003-2004 plan for cooperation in standardization, measurement and quality control was signed on the same day between the DPRK State Bureau of Quality Control and the Chinese State General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine.

Greetings to Chilean Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Chilean Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Chilean counterpart Maria Soledad Alvear Valenzuela.
 Extending warm congratulations to her on the independence day of Chile, the message wished her greater success in her future work.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Soccer Team
Greetings to Prime Minister of St. Kitts-Nevis
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of St. Kitts-Nevis
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju of the DPRK Cabinet sent a message of greetings to Denzil Douglas, prime minister of St. Kitts-Nevis, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the people of St. Kitts-Nevis happiness and expressed the belief that the bonds of friendship between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Chilean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Chilean President
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Ricardo Lagos Escobar, president of Chile, on Sept.18 on the occasion of its independence day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Chile would continue to favorably develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president greater success in his responsible work for peace and economic prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Plan for Cultural Exchange Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
articles.content:
Plan for Cultural Exchange Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The 2003-2005 plan for cultural exchange between the governments of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and Mongolia was signed in Mongolia on September 16.
 Present at a signing ceremony were members of the DPRK government cultural delegation led by Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, A. Tsanjid, minister of Education, Culture and Science of Mongolia, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Anniversary of Pyongyang Metro Marked
British VIPs Leave
articles.content:
British VIPs Leave
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Caroline Anne Cox, vice-president of the House of Lords of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, and her party left today after winding up their six-day visit to the DPRK.
 They were seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Ri Jong Hyok, chairman of the DPRK-Britain Friendship Parliamentary Group, and British Ambassador to the DPRK David Arthur Slinn.

articles.title: Monuments to Kim Jong Il's Field Guidance Erected
DPRK Supports UN Resolution on Lifting Sanctions Imposed on Libya
articles.content:
DPRK Supports UN Resolution on Lifting Sanctions Imposed on Libya
    Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Abdulrahman Mohamed Shalgham, secretary of the General People's Committee for Foreign Liaison and International Cooperation of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, as regards the UNSC's recent adoption of a resolution on lifting sanctions imposed on Libya.
 The recent UN resolution is a result of endeavors made by the Libyan leadership and people for a long time, the message noted, adding that this would help create internal and external environment favorable for building new Libya, free and prosperous.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would as ever grow stronger and develop, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work.
